node.title: US putting out the welcome mat for the first time in nearly two years
node.description: The United States is expecting a flood of international visitors today as the country's land and air borders are reopened to travellers for the first time since early 2020.
node.content:
["The United States is expecting a flood of international visitors today as the country's land and air borders reopen\u00a0to travellers for the first time since early 2020.", "COVID-19 concerns prompted the US to close its borders to international travellers from countries including Brazil, China, India, South Africa, the United Kingdom and much of Europe more than a year and a half ago.", "Foreign air travellers will be required to provide proof of vaccination status prior to boarding an plane to fly to the US, with limited exceptions.\u00a0All\u00a0travellers must produce a negative viral test result.", "The US is also reopening its\u00a0land borders with Canada and Mexico \u2014 which have\u00a0been only open for \"essential\" travel \u2014 for vaccinated people.", "Most trips from Canada and Mexico to the US are by land rather than air.", "The goal is to restore more normal travel while limiting the spread of COVID-19, the US government says.", "Meanwhile, the travel industry and European allies have pushed for an end to country-specific bans.", "Americans have been allowed to fly to Europe for months, and Europeans have been pushing the US to change its policies.", "", "
Travellers have been told to expect long lines following the lifting of restrictions.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Kevin Mohatt/File)
", "
'It's going to be a bit sloppy at first'
", "United Airlines is expecting about 50 per cent more total international inbound passengers compared to last Monday when it had about 20,000.", "And Delta Air Lines chief executive Ed Bastian has warned travellers should be prepared for initial long lines.", "\"It's going to be a bit sloppy at first. I can assure you, there will be lines, unfortunately,\" Mr Bastian said, adding that it would get sorted out.", "Delta said that, in the six weeks since the US reopening was announced, it has seen a 450 per cent increase in international point-of-sale bookings versus the previous six weeks.", "White House spokesman Kevin Munoz said on Twitter: \"As we expect high demand when the US lifts its existing air and land travel restrictions Monday, we are taking critical steps to be prepared by providing additional resources.\"", "", "
Foreigners wanting to visit the US have to show proof of vaccination with a\u00a0US\u00a0FDA-approved, FDA-authorised or WHO\u00a0emergency use listed vaccine.(AP: Mike Morones)
", "The Biden administration has warned travellers crossing from Canada and Mexico by land or ferry to be prepared for longer waits starting today.", "Country-based travel bans had barred most non-US citizens who, within the prior 14 days, had been in 33 countries: the 26 Schengen countries in Europe without border controls, China, India, South Africa, Iran, Brazil, Britain and Ireland.", "Trade group US Travel said those\u00a0countries accounted for 53 per cent of all overseas visitors to the US in 2019 and border communities were hit hard by the loss of tourists crossing from Mexico and Canada.", "Since March 2020, the group estimated,\u00a0declines in international visitation \"resulted in nearly $300 billion in lost export income\".", "US airlines are boosting flights to Europe and other destinations that were impacted by the restrictions.", "Many international flights are expected to operate at close to full or full today, with high passenger volumes throughout the following weeks.", "Airlines will check vaccination documentation for international travellers as they currently do for COVID-19 test results.", "At land border crossings, US Customs and Border Protection will ask if travellers have been vaccinated and spot-check some documentation.", "Children under 18 years are exempt from the new vaccine requirements.", "Non-tourist travellers from nearly 50 countries with nationwide vaccination rates of less than 10 per cent will also be eligible for exemption.", "Reuters/AP"]
